meanings.definition: A fermata is a symbol in musical notation indicating that a note should be prolonged beyond its normal duration.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, the pianist paused at the fermata, holding the note longer.
meanings.sent2: The fermata at the end of the piece allowed the singer to showcase their vocal range.
meanings.sent3: The fermata on the sheet music seemed to wink at the violinist, daring them to play longer.
meanings.sent4: As the fermata hung in the air, time itself seemed to stretch and slow down.
meanings.sent5: The fermata acted like a spotlight, drawing attention to the sustained note.
